evidence: As X-rays pass through biological tissue, they are progressively attenuated.
A useful way to describe this is the half-value layer concept.
the result is an exponential reduction in the beam.
only about one percent of the electron energy is converted into usable X-ray photons
highly sensitive detectors to record even the relatively small number of photons that emerge.
smart algorithms to make the most of the limited data
Next, we will introduce the mathematical description of attenuation - Beer’s Law

triples.evidence: Next, we will introduce the mathematical description of attenuation - Beer’s Law - which provides a precise model for this exponential process.

concepts.term: suppose you start with 1,000 x-ray photons. After passing through the first half-value layer, about half remain - 500 photons. After a second half-value layer of the same thickness, the number drops to about 250. After a few layers, only a small fraction of the original photons survive
